law.catch_line: Kentucky Physicians Care Program -- Provision of primary health care services to eligible individuals -- Volunteer networks -- Advisory committees.

text.section: To the extent possible with available funds, the Cabinet for Health and Family Services shall establish and operate the Kentucky Physicians Care Program to assist low-income uninsured and underinsured individuals in accessing primary health care services provided by volunteer health care practitioners and pharmaceutical drugs donated by pharmaceutical companies.

The program may access networks of practitioners, pharmacies, and pharmaceutical companies that are maintained by entities that recruit volunteers and donations, such as Health Kentucky, Inc. and the Kentucky Free Health Clinic Association, to locate necessary health care services for eligible applicants.

The program may:
Create temporary volunteer advisory committees to provide input on program operations and efficiencies;
Contract with qualified, independent third parties to provide services; and
Apply for federal funds or other grants to operate the program.

law.history: Amended 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 118, sec. 6, effective June 25, 2013. -- Created 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 155, sec. 1, effective July 12, 2006.
